did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, articles, notes, slides, photographs, videotapes.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
did.abstract: Material relating to Eleanor J. Gibson's education, research, and career as a Professor of Psychology.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Psychology and holder of the Susan Linn Sage Chair, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p:
Collection includes Eleanor Gibson's Masters Thesis from Smith; PhD Thesis from Yale; and other material from her graduate studies. Items relating to her teaching career include lecture notes, demonstration materials, experiment designs, examinations and students' papers. Also included are grant proposals and data from experiments conducted at Cornell's Graduate Psychological Laboratories in various aspects of perception and learning such as childhood reading disorders, scanning, word perception, and information processing; material for
Psychology of Reading; and An Odyssey in Learning and Perception ; vitae and biographical sketches; 1992 National Medal of Science Award memorabilia; articles by Eleanor J. Gibson, James J. Gibson, and other psychology scholars separated by author and subject; notes and slides for lectures, talks, and colloquiums; folders of correspondence; tape recording of E.G. Boring's 1967 speech on the founding of the Society of Experimental Psychologists delivered at the centennial of the birth of Edward B. Titchener; and assorted floppy disks.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Eleanor Gibson Papers, #14-23-2658. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p: Material from Eleanor Gibson's undergraduate and graduate studies including her masters and doctoral theses, vitae and biographical sketches, correspondence, material relating to her 1992 National Medal of Science Award, and articles written by Eleanor Gibson.
Notes and articles arranged by subject.
Notes and articles by colleagues and other psychology scholars

emph.ref:
Series IV. Talks, Lectures, and Classes,
1931-1998

arrangement.p: Notes, slides, and articles for classes, lectures, and talks.
